About Me

I am Mutesa Willy, an independent Rwandan Creative Front-End Developer with over 3 years of experience in modern web design and development. I specialize in building engaging, responsive, and visually compelling digital experiences using technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Tailwind CSS. My work has spanned collaborations with international clients, design studios, and creative startups, where I’ve consistently delivered high-quality, user-centered web solutions.

Academically, I am currently pursuing my Advanced Level studies at The Agahozo-Shalom Youth Village (ASYV), majoring in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science. ASYV is known for its holistic education model that combines academic rigor with personal development, and I actively engage in its technical and creative communities. My academic interests include software development, visual computing, mathematics, and applied physics.

In addition to front-end development, I’ve explored areas like 3D modeling, Adobe Creative Suite, and UI/UX prototyping with tools such as Figma and InDesign. I’m also part of several tech and innovation clubs at ASYV, including Python programming, Byte Builders, and Jackal Tech, where I continue to build skills in coding, problem-solving, and collaborative innovation.

As a freelancer, I am currently open to remote collaborations and partnerships with forward-thinking agencies and creatives that value excellence, originality, and meaningful design.

Awards & Recognitions

Certificates, competitive selections, and institutional honors validating my interdisciplinary growth

Grade Representative and Mister Core Values, ASYV (Agahozo Shalom Youth Village)

(October 2022)

Worked hand in hand with ASYV school administration and staff to solve students' problems in Ishami Grade; organized meetings to evaluate academic/social progress; helped coordinate village time and represented the grade in various events.

Scholar, Yale Young African Scholars Program, Yale University

(July 18–23, 2024)

Participated in an intensive academic and enrichment program for African youth aspiring to become transformative leaders and change-makers across the continent.

Student Author, Imagine We Publishers

(Present)

Published "AMISTAD IS NOT FROM TERROR OR TREASURE" through a workshop with Imagine We Publishers and ASYV. Story promotes friendship based on love and care rather than fear or wealth.

Isomo Circles Scholar, Isomo Academy-Bridge2Rwanda Program

(Present)

This program empowers and supports scholars through digital resources, critical skills, and leadership opportunities to excel in the 21st century.

Student, ASYV Python Class in Partnership with Carnegie Mellon University

(Present)

Learning a graphics-based curriculum in Python to build coding skills and problem-solving abilities.

Active Member, ASYV Byte Builders Club

(Present)

Learning programming languages like HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript to develop skills in creating projects that address real-world problems.

Student, ASYV 3D Modeling Class

(Present)

Creating models using SOLIDWORKS and 3D printers, developing mechanical design skills through hands-on projects.

Active Participant, In Charge of Club Innovations, ASYV Critical Thinking for Peace Club & MUN

(Present)

Attended camps and participated in activities like peacekeeping and SDGs; contributed ideas to club projects and led events commemorating the Rwandan Genocide.

Jackal Tech Company, Mechanics Assistant

(Present)

Assists with mechanical projects in the Science Center; designs mechanical solutions using SOLIDWORKS from concept to final product.

Active Participant, Coordinator, ASYV Sign Language Club

(Present)

Coordinates sign language classes, teaching students basic hand gestures and expressions through videos and presentations.
